clues.text: The "Good Neighbor" Bridge is one of several that cross this river from Juarez, Mexico to El Paso
Fittingly, this Texas city has a 65-foot-tall replica of the Eiffel Tower
Brought from across the pond in 1959, a piece of this rock can be found on  display in the town of Shamrock, Texas
This word for a perfect human society is from words meaning "no place", but it's a real place west of San Antonio
Zaragoza Street & Convent Avenue are 2 downtown "streets of" this seat of Webb County
The mascot of Penn & the nickname of its sports teams is this religious one
Begun in 1909, the Whiffenpoofs are a celebrated collegiate singing group at this university
Woodrow Wilson had been president of Princeton & Dwight Eisenhower had been president of this NYC Ivy League school
Chartered as Rhode Island College in 1764, it changed its name to this in 1804 to honor a major benefactor
Harvard banned filming of Hollywood movies after this Ryan O'Neal/Ali MacGraw tearjerker ruined trees with fake snow
This festival started by Ludwig of Bavaria is more than 200 years old
On December 1, 1918 Transylvania made it official & reunited with this country
In 1648 throngs of these horseman warriors in the Ukraine rose up against Polish rule
In 2010 Greece, in exchange for financial help, agreed to these measures whose name means "harshness"
In 1215 the Articles of Barons, or Magna Carta, was sealed by King John in this mede or meadow
After not 1 but 2 nuclear wars, books are burned to prevent complicated thought in this 1953 sci-fi classic
Jules Verne's first novel was "Cinq Semaines en Ballon", or this long "in a balloon"
The sequel to Ernest Cline's bestseller about Wade Watts solving a fantastic virtual reality puzzle has this logical name
In an 1844 Alexandre Dumas novel this member of the title trio is alphabetically last
This Jane Smiley Pulitzer Prize winner about the inheritance of a large Iowa farm is a modern retelling of "King Lear"
This writ "shall not be suspended, unless when in cases of rebellion or invasion the public safety may require it"
Article I, Section 3 says this official "shall have no vote, unless they be equally divided"
The president has the power "by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, to make" these agreements
Article 3 says, "the trial of all crimes, except in cases of" this, "shall be by jury"
Article 1, Section 8 gives Congress power to grant these "letters" that allow privately owned ships to be used as warships
A place where criminals evade the law loses "out" to become this, also a term for a pelt
A term for something no longer in fashion loses "out", becoming this past tense verb regarding social coupling
A word meaning excellent loses its initial "out", becoming this action performed by many waiting in line
What the banking industry got in 2008 loses "out" & needs to head to a bondsman for this
"Out" is dropped from a word for a gridiron ball catcher, becoming this expansive word
The Louisiana Purchase added more than 800,000 square miles of territory west of this river, the "Father of Waters"
This pres. said the purchase was "the case of a guardian, investing the money of his ward... saying... I did this for your good"
This range was considered the western border of the Louisiana Purchase
Members of this party founded by Alexander Hamilton weren't big fans of the purchase & questioned its constitutionality
The U.S. budgeted $2 million to buy New Orleans & a bit of Fla.; the "Talley" was $15 mil. when this French minister offered lots more
Benjamin Bunny marries Flopsy, the sister of this title rabbit from a Beatrix Potter tale
In "Charlotte's Web" he's the pig whose life is spared thanks to Charlotte
In books by Kathryn Lasky, the guardians of Ga'Hoole are a band of these birds that do noble deeds
This "Fantastic" character from a 1970 tale is the bane of poultry farmers Boggis & Bunce
In a 1939 T.S. Eliot poem, this cat "has lived many lives in succession"
Back in 1999 Exxon merged with this corporation; both had their roots in the Standard Oil Company
This company "crawled" onto the New York Stock Exchange in 1929 with just 3 products: a combine, a grader & a tractor
In 2020 Pat Hanrahan & Ed Catmull of this CGI animation company won the Turing Award, called the Nobel Prize of computing
Ford Motors turned waste wood from auto making into charcoal briquets, which became this brand with "ford" in its name
Although it no longer makes its famous Cubs, this aircraft maker is still in business after more than 80 years
In 1995 this future Supreme Court justice played serious hardball, helping end the Major League Baseball strike
In Puerto Rico 1/3 of fertile women were undergoing this, many without consent; Dr. Helen Rodriguez Trias fought the practice
In 2021 Alejandro Mayorkas became the first Latino secretary of this cabinet department that deals with immigration
Oscar Hijuelos was the first Hispanic American to win a fiction Pulitzer, for the book called these fellows "Play Songs of Love"
Last name of twins Joaquin, in Congress since 2013, & Juli√°n, formerly a mayor of San Antonio & HUD secretary
A person used by others as part of a scheme
The first night of a play at a theater
A gregarious crow of Europe with black plumage
A title in kung fu, or a famous nickname in '70s hip-hop
Genesis 31 says, "Then Jacob offered" this "upon the mount"
Lavoisier said he never got Scheele's 1774 letter about discovering this component of water, but it was found in his papers
The first one of these discovered in the human body was secretin, produced by the small intestine, in 1902
The discovery of a fault scarp in Washington state showed that recent tremors are these still happening from an 1872 earthquake
The Curies gave Paul Villard some radium & he discovered these very high-energy Greek-letter rays
A 9-year-old found a clavicle that turned out to belong to an unknown species of this "southern ape" genus that also included Lucy

rounds.text:
The 1st line spoken in this Shakespearean play is 1 word:
"Bos'n!"
